description: From Ancient Greek ἀνάδρομος (anádromos), from ἀνά (aná, “up”) + δρόμος (drómos, “running”).

entries.meaning: (of a migratory fish) That lives in the sea and breeds in fresh water.
examples: Shads and most species of salmon are anadromous.

entries.meaning: (botany) Of a fern in which the first veins in a frond segment are produced towards the apex of the frond.
